oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Merle Haggard interview - Ralph Emery
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of a phone interview with Merle Haggard (performer), as conducted by Ralph Emery on May 1, 1974.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Ralph Emery introduces Merle Haggard -- (00:22) Merle Haggard talks about being on the cover of Time magazine -- (01:25) Haggard talks about the content in his Time magazine article, including his train -- (02:22) Haggard talks about being too busy to keep up with his train hobby -- (03:16) Haggard talks about it being a great honor to represent country music on the cover of Time -- (03:32) Haggard talks about how much time was spent on the article -- (04:25) Haggard talks about how long the interviewing process took for the article, and that he was quite pleased with the article -- (06:00) Haggard talks about why he is recording in Texas rather than Bakersfield -- (06:40) Haggard talks about making appearances around Texas while recording, and when he plans to come back to Nashville -- (07:13) Haggard talks about taking a month off each year to go fishing -- (07:55) Haggard talks about some of his other favorite fishing spots around the country -- (08:45) Haggard talks about James Franciscus -- (09:28) Haggard talks about wanting to do more television in the future -- (11:00) Haggard talks about when his next recording will be released -- (11:25) Haggard thanks Ralph and concludes the interview -- (11:42) Emery ends the segment
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Haggard, Merle, 1937-2016; Haggard, Merle; Emery, Ralph; WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.);
